intro: Primula reginella, commonly known as the queen's primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features dark green, ovate leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
